articles.author: Joanna Robin, Lucy Sweeney
articles.title: State of the Union live: Joe Biden shuts US airspace to Russia over Ukraine invasion and outlines plan to ease cost of living for Americans - ABC News
articles.description: The US President has promised further action to punish Russian leader Vladimir Putin and outlined his vision to ease Americans' rising cost of living in his first State of the Union address. Look back over our live blog.
articles.content: The President wraps up his speech with an impassioned message to the American people: "Fellow Americans, tonight we have gathered in this sacred space. A citadel of democracy. In this capitol, genera… [+1494 chars]

articles.title: U.S. to Ban Russian Flights From American Airspace - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Move follows similar prohibitions by European and Canadian authorities
articles.content: The U.S. government will ban Russian aircraft from American airspace, broadening aviation restrictions as the West expands sanctions over the war in Ukraine, President Biden said Tuesday during his S… [+3471 chars]

articles.author: Tyrone Clarke
articles.title: Joe Biden mobilises full American forces to ‘defend’ NATO - Sky News Australia
articles.description: President Joe Biden has vowed to “defend every inch of territory” of NATO partners with the full force of the US military should Vladimir Putin encroach further west.
articles.content: President Joe Biden has declared Vladimir Putin is more isolated from the world than ever before as he vows to defend every inch of NATO territory during his first State of the Union address.Presiden… [+3553 chars]

articles.title: Apple, Ford, other big US brands join corporate wave shunning Russia - CNA
articles.description:
Some of America's best-known companies including Apple, Google, Ford, Harley-Davidson and ExxonMobil rebuked and rejected Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, under steady pressure from investors and consumers decrying the violence.

articles.title: Europe's joint Mars mission with Russia postponed by war - 1News
articles.description: While Europe has its own rockets to put satellites into orbit, it relies on Russian and American partners to send astronauts into space.
articles.content:
The launch of a joint Europe-Russia mission to Mars this year is now very unlikely due to sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine, the European Space Agency said on Tuesday.
